<!-- source-hash: 4400696dbaad382dca212fcc461f904d -->
A custom runtime exception used to indicate when a requested log entry cannot be found in the system.

## Key Components

- **LogNotFoundException** - Custom runtime exception class that extends `RuntimeException`
- **Constructor** - Single parameterized constructor accepting an error message

## Usage Example

```java
// Throwing the exception when a log is not found
public LogEntry getLogById(String logId) {
    LogEntry log = logRepository.findById(logId);
    if (log == null) {
        throw new LogNotFoundException("Log with ID " + logId + " not found");
    }
    return log;
}

// Catching and handling the exception
try {
    LogEntry log = logService.getLogById("LOG123");
    // Process log...
} catch (LogNotFoundException e) {
    System.err.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
    // Handle missing log scenario
}
```

This exception follows standard Java exception patterns and can be caught specifically or as part of the broader `RuntimeException` hierarchy. It's typically used in logging systems, audit trails, or any component that manages log entries where retrieval operations may fail.
